helps.text:
Many centuries ago, around the time of the Goblin Wars, which took the lives
of so many Elves, Dwarves and Humans on the Plains of Blood, there existed
a vile and crafty warlock named Baragar, and he resided in a fell keep
near the jagged peak of Mount Doom. By traveling to the past dimension, you
will have the chance to meet and slay this evil mercenary who worked against
his own race for the money of foul forces such as Krogthar, Jher and Lord
Vax. The warlock is not alone in his keep, however, and you will find
yourself pitted against many heinous foes in your journey.

mobiles.name: warlock baragar
mobiles.long_description: The warlock Baragar chuckles at you and dares you to attack him.
mobiles.description:
Before you stands the master of the keep, Baragar the warlock. And while
Baragar is weak compared to sorcerers such as Krogthar and his minions,
or the vile Jher, he is no pushover either.

Baragar is a handsome young man with long white hair, and deep blue eyes.
He would appear to be almost angelic were it not for the diabolical gleam
to his eyes, and the evil grin on his thin, cruel lips.

mobiles.name: woman witch alara
mobiles.long_description: A comely woman in her early twenties grins at you.
mobiles.description:
This woman is the witch Alara, associate and lover of Baragar. She is nude
save for a leather bandolier across her chest and buttocks, which contains
a variety of potions, scrolls and throwing daggers. She would be very
attractive if she didn't cackle insanely so much.

mobiles.name: demon
mobiles.long_description: A minor demon hisses and snarls at you.
mobiles.description:
Baragar and Alara managed to capture this demon and keep it in this room,
but they lacked the power necessary to control it, so they dare not release
it again. And now you're in here with this eight foot tall, four armed,
green skinned monstrosity from the lower planes. Great.

mobiles.name: cat familiar
mobiles.long_description: Alara's familiar, a black cat, hisses at you.
mobiles.description: This angry feline is Alara's familiar. Do away with it.

mobiles.name: hawk familiar
mobiles.long_description: Alara's familiar, a hawk, screeches at you.
mobiles.description: This angry bird is Baragar's familiar. Do away with it.

mobiles.name: asura guard
mobiles.long_description: A asura guard squints suspiciously at you.
mobiles.description:
These asuras are meant to prevent strangers from entering the inner keep,
but they see so many strange creatures here they aren't sure which type is
allowed and which isn't.

mobiles.name: flesh golem
mobiles.long_description: A flesh golem stands here, arms folded.
mobiles.description:
This mindless automaton is a creation of Baragar's. It answers only to him,
a fact which irritates (and worries) Alara.

mobiles.name: fire drake
mobiles.long_description: A fire drake snorts flames and attacks!
mobiles.description:
This angry dragonkin has been roused from its nap by you, and it isn't happy
about it...

mobiles.name: zombie servant
mobiles.long_description: A zombie servant gazes at you blankly.
mobiles.description:
This poor fellow was once a living servant of Baragar who made one mistake
too many. Baragar eventually decided undead staff were far more reliable,
if a little slower, and slew all his staff, turning them subsequently into
mindless undead. That's what a charming guy he is.

mobiles.name: guard
mobiles.long_description: A keep guard stands rigidly at attention here.
mobiles.description:
This guard is slightly bemused at your entrance, but doesn't move to stop
you- Baragar receives dozens of visitors daily, and if they are powerful
enough to slay him, then the guards certainly don't stand a chance, so they
keep quiet. You may wonder why in that case Baragar bothers having guards.
Well, so does he.

mobiles.name: apprentice
mobiles.long_description: An apprentice mage looks up from her work, startled.
mobiles.description:
This woman was a former lover of Alara's who was brought here by the witch
as a student after Alara hooked up with Baragar, a warlock of a different
gender. She is small, cute, and evil.

mobiles.name: grell
mobiles.long_description: A grell gropes at you with its tentacles.
mobiles.description:
This looks like a huge brain with green tentacles and a huge squid-like
beak. It hovers in the center of the room, glaring at you menacingly.

mobiles.name: mimic
mobiles.long_description: A wooden chest suddenly comes to life!
mobiles.description:
This mimic has been placed here by Baragar to fool (and hopefully slay)
potential thieves.

mobiles.name: crocodile
mobiles.long_description: A hungry crocodile snaps its jaws at you.
mobiles.description:
This hungry reptile hasn't been fed in days. Baragar starves his crocs to
keep them savage. He uses them to punish his guards. They seldom make
the same mistake twice, because they are usually dead.

mobiles.name: war dog
mobiles.long_description: A savage war dog snarls viciously at you.
mobiles.description:
Baragar bred these brutes from the most vicious alsatians and pit bulls he
could find, then infected them with super-rabies to make 'em nice and
friendly.

mobiles.name: assassin
mobiles.long_description: An assassin appears suddenly before you.
mobiles.description:
This mysterious woman is one of Baragar's elite black-robed assassins.
Closely aligned with the assassins of Krogthar's domain, they are cold-
blooded, ruthless fanatics devoted to their ruler.

mobiles.name: dagar assassin
mobiles.long_description: Dagar the assassin urges you to be silent.
mobiles.description:
Dagar is an agent of Thalos, sent here to eliminate Baragar. He has spent
weeks infiltrating the keep, and is now in the final stages of his plan.
However, he'd be more than happy for you to complete the task for him.

mobiles.name: gnoll slave
mobiles.long_description: A gnoll slave yelps in surprise at your presence.
mobiles.description:
These evil dog-like humanoids have been captured by Baragar and set to work
as miners and laborers helping to excavate the ancient lower cavers beneath
the keep.

mobiles.name: ogre slave
mobiles.long_description: An ogre slave grunts as you enter, then turns back to his work.
mobiles.description:
These evil giant-kin have been captured by Baragar and set to work as miners
and laborers helping to excavate the ancient lower cavers beneath the keep.

mobiles.name: flind slave master
mobiles.long_description: A flind slave master howls fiercely and orders you to leave.
mobiles.description:
This gnoll-kin has been placed in charge of the gnolls and ogres that
labor here, and will not tolerate any interruptions.

mobiles.name: otyugh
mobiles.long_description: An otyugh gibbers and attacks!
mobiles.description:
This creature is a trangular mass of flesh with a huge maw and two tentacles.
It rushes toward you on stubby legs. It is used to devour the garbage of
the keep.

old_objects.name: robes
old_objects.description: Some black robes have been left here.

old_objects.name: staff
old_objects.description: A bone staff lies here.

old_objects.name: sword
old_objects.description: A bone sword is stuck in the ground here.

old_objects.name: helm
old_objects.description: A bronze helm covered in runes has been left here.

old_objects.name: bandolier
old_objects.description: A leather bandolier lies here.

old_objects.name: potion
old_objects.description: A bright green potion has been left here.

old_objects.name: potion
old_objects.description: A bright red potion has been left here.

old_objects.name: scroll
old_objects.description: A lightning scroll is curled up on the floor here.

old_objects.name: scroll
old_objects.description: A fire scroll is curled up on the floor here.

old_objects.name: wand
old_objects.description: A wand inscribed with strange runes lies here.

old_objects.name: dagger
old_objects.description: A rune-covered dagger has been left here.

old_objects.name: staff
old_objects.description: A staff fashioned of garthalanium has been left here.

old_objects.name: pentagram
old_objects.description: A pentagram has been inscribed upon the floor here.

old_objects.name: spiked club
old_objects.description: A spiked club lies here.

old_objects.name: leather hauberk
old_objects.description: A leather hauberk has been dropped here.

old_objects.name: drake hide
old_objects.description: The hide of a fire drake has been removed and left here.

old_objects.name: bronze plate
old_objects.description: A suit of bronze plate has been piled up here.

old_objects.name: bronze shield
old_objects.description: A bronze shield lies here.

old_objects.name: bronze helm
old_objects.description: A bronze helm has been left here.

old_objects.name: bronze sword
old_objects.description: A bronze sword is buried in the ground here.

old_objects.name: robes
old_objects.description: Some green robes are crumpled up on the floor here.

old_objects.name: staff
old_objects.description: A wooden staff with a bronze head lies here.

old_objects.name: spellbook
old_objects.description: A spellbook with bronze fittings lies here.

old_objects.name: pit
old_objects.description: A deep pit yawns before you.

old_objects.name: collar
old_objects.description: A spiked dog collar lies here.

old_objects.name: assassin robes
old_objects.description: The black robes of an assassin have been torn from her and left here.

old_objects.name: dagger
old_objects.description: A throwing dagger has been left here.

old_objects.name: sword
old_objects.description: A rare steel sword covered in runes lies here.

old_objects.name: ring
old_objects.description: A magic ring floats by here.

old_objects.name: boots
old_objects.description: A pair of çora boots lie here.

old_objects.name: elven cloak
old_objects.description: A green çora cloak has been left here.

old_objects.name: pick
old_objects.description: A pick rests here.

old_objects.name: shovel
old_objects.description: A shovel rests here.

old_objects.name: rubble
old_objects.description: A pile of rubble has been made here.

old_objects.name: whip
old_objects.description: A whip has been curled up here.

old_objects.name: flind bar
old_objects.description: A flind bar has been left here.

old_objects.name: rubbish
old_objects.description: A huge pile of rubbish is here.

old_objects.name: rack
old_objects.description: A torturer's rack sits near one wall.

extra_descriptions.description:
It is not currently in use. The warlock enjoys executions, so people he
captures rarely live long enough to be tortured.

old_objects.name: gallows
old_objects.description: A gallows has been erected here.

extra_descriptions.description: They are used regularly to hang those who piss off the warlock.

old_objects.name: stocks
old_objects.description: The stocks sit here, holding a pathetic wretch of a gnoll.

extra_descriptions.description: This unfortunate has been left here for a week for insubordination.

old_objects.name: pot boiling oil
old_objects.description: A pot of boiling oil bubbles away here.

extra_descriptions.description: The warlock enjoys immersing insubordinate or irritating lackeys in here.

old_objects.name: flag
old_objects.description: A black flag flutters atop a pole here.

extra_descriptions.description: It is plain black. The warlock isn't very imaginative.

old_objects.name: leg irons
old_objects.description: A set of leg irons rest here.

rooms.name: The Path to the Keep
rooms.description:
You are heading toward a bleak blackstone keep, sitting in the middle of
a field of scorched earth. Surly guards patrol both on the battlements and
below before the gate, but they pay you little heed. Evidently the guards
are used to strange visitors...

rooms.name: Before the Keep
rooms.description:
You are standing outside the massive bronze-bound oak portals that bar the
way into the keep. They currently stand open, though, as if the warlock
were expecting visitors...

rooms.name: A Guard Tower
rooms.description:
This tower sits above the gate you just entered. Guards march back and forth.
They seem mildly surprised by your entrance, but they don't move to hinder
you. The stairs continue up and down.

rooms.name: The Roof of the Tower
rooms.description:
You emerge onto the roof of the tower. From here you can see far across the
plains of Past Anon. The ancient city of Thalos, ruined in your own time,
lies far to the south, while to the east lie the jagged peaks of the first
mountain range of Anon. It is rumored that the gods temselves reside at their
lofty peaks. Beyond them, you can see the peak of Mount Doom, whereupon
the castle of the dread Lord Krogthar is located.

rooms.name: Inside the Keep
rooms.description:
Guards march to and fro in this small courtyard. Wooden portals lie to the
north, west and south, while the entry gate looms to the east. A set of
stairs leads up into the tower of the gatehouse.

rooms.name: The Stables
rooms.description:
Here the guards of the Keep keep, or kept, rather, their steeds. A
particularly harsh winter left the Keep short of food, and necessitated
the eating of the horses. They have not been replaced yet.

rooms.name: Barracks
rooms.description:
This room quarters some of the guards of the Keep. There are several bunks
littered with dirty underwear and frayed tunics- evidently the warlock is
not a stickler for discipline.

rooms.name: The Inner Courtyard
rooms.description:
You have passed into the inner courtyard, which lies before the stark black
walls of the inner keep, wherein resides Baragar and his consort Alara.
Guards occasionally stroll past, as does the occasional servant. The
servants appear to be rather lifeless and cold...

rooms.name: The Inner Courtyard
rooms.description:
You have passed into the inner courtyard, which lies before the stark black
walls of the inner keep, wherein resides Baragar and his consort Alara.
Guards occasionally stroll past, as does the occasional servant. The
servants appear to be rather lifeless and cold...

rooms.name: The Inner Courtyard
rooms.description:
You have passed into the inner courtyard, which lies before the stark black
walls of the inner keep, wherein resides Baragar and his consort Alara.
Guards occasionally stroll past, as does the occasional servant. The
servants appear to be rather lifeless and cold...

rooms.name: The Inner Courtyard
rooms.description:
You have passed into the inner courtyard, which lies before the stark black
walls of the inner keep, wherein resides Baragar and his consort Alara.
Guards occasionally stroll past, as does the occasional servant. The
servants appear to be rather lifeless and cold...

The doors to the inner keep lie to the west of here.

rooms.name: The Inner Courtyard
rooms.description:
You have passed into the inner courtyard, which lies before the stark black
walls of the inner keep, wherein resides Baragar and his consort Alara.
Guards occasionally stroll past, as does the occasional servant. The
servants appear to be rather lifeless and cold...

rooms.name: The Inner Courtyard
rooms.description:
You have passed into the inner courtyard, which lies before the stark black
walls of the inner keep, wherein resides Baragar and his consort Alara.
Guards occasionally stroll past, as does the occasional servant. The
servants appear to be rather lifeless and cold...

rooms.name: The Garbage Pit
rooms.description:
Here the keep's occupants dump their garbage, to be devoured by the offal-
eating creature they keep in here. It smells very bad.... very VERY bad...

rooms.name: The Crocodile Pit
rooms.description:
Here Baragar keeps his pet crocodiles, whom he feeds insubordinate guards
or slaves to. They are rather hungry, and they would take great pleasure
in devouring you.

rooms.name: The Inner Keep
rooms.description:
You stand within the inner keep. The entry room is a small dark chamber,
with only four wooden doors to break the monotony of the black walls.

rooms.name: Guard Room
rooms.description:
here some of the asura guards of the inner keep reside. They dislike
intruders, though they are under orders from Baragar not to slay any, for
he is intensely curious as to the nature of any visitors, welcome or not.

rooms.name: Guard Room
rooms.description:
here some of the asura guards of the inner keep reside. They dislike
intruders, though they are under orders from Baragar not to slay any, for
he is intensely curious as to the nature of any visitors, welcome or not.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description:
These steps lead up into the upper levels of the keep, or down into the
dungeons. You can hear sounds of construction coming from below.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description:
These steps lead up into the upper levels of the keep, or down into the
dungeons. You can hear sounds of construction coming from below.

rooms.name: Antechamber
rooms.description:
This small room is totally windowless, and would be utterly dark were it
not for your pale light source. You feel uneasy here. Far away, someone
screams, and you shiver uncomfortably.

rooms.name: Assassins' Quarters
rooms.description:
Here the assassins of Baragar reside, spending their spare time playing
cards, making poisons, killing peasant rabble captured by the guards, etc.
They will not be impressed by your intrusion...

rooms.name: Apprentice Quarters
rooms.description:
Here resides Alara's apprentice and sometime bed-partner. The apprentice
has little to do with Baragar, as Baragar envies and distrusts her, but he
dares not slay her for Alara would be displeased...

rooms.name: Antechamber
rooms.description:
This small room is totally windowless, and would be utterly dark were it
not for your pale light source. You feel uneasy here. Far away, someone
screams, and you shiver uncomfortably.

rooms.name: Baragar's Chambers
rooms.description:
Baragar himself resides here, in this small room. It is rather spartan,
furnished only with a small military cot, a desk and a shelf full of books.
You are surprised that such a wicked man would be so neat and disciplined.

rooms.name: Alara's Chamber
rooms.description:
Yang to Baragar's Yin, Alara's room represents just how different they are.
Her room is sloppy and messy, filled with useless junk and piles of unwashed
clothing. There are two large beds, covered with expensive silks and pillows.
A set of manacles hangs from one wall, used for some perversion you don't
care to find out more about.

rooms.name: A Stairwell
rooms.description:
These steps lead up into the upper levels of the keep, or down into the
dungeons. You can hear sounds of construction coming from below.

rooms.name: The Dungeons
rooms.description:
You are in the dank, damp and dirty dungeons of the Keep. The passage you
are in extends west into darkness. You can hear the sounds of construction
more clearly now.

rooms.name: The Dungeons
rooms.description:
You are in the dank, damp and dirty dungeons of the Keep. The passage you
are in extends west into darkness. You can hear the sounds of construction
more clearly now.

Doors lie to the north and south of here. The southern door has strange
runes inscribed upon it.

exits.description: This door is inscribed with strange runes

rooms.name: A Treasure Room
rooms.description:
This room has a huge chest cram-packed with loot in the middle of it. But
as you enter, you feel rather uneasy about the whole situation.

rooms.name: A Summoning Room
rooms.description:
Baragar and Alara use (or used) this room for practicing their gate spells,
but when one spell summoned a denizen of the lower planes that they couldn't
control, they hastily sealed it in this room. And now you have released it.
Way to go.

rooms.name: A Junction
rooms.description:
You are at a rather busy junction in the dungeons. To the north runs a dark
passage, while to the south lies a door. To the west lies the source of
the noises you heard earlier. it is obvious that a team of workers is
excavating down here. Perhaps Baraga wishes to unearth the treasures
rumored to lie in the ancient caverns beneath his keep...?

rooms.name: The Entryway to the Mines
rooms.description:
Here there is a crude elevator which you can use to lower yourself into
the lower caverns, wherein the excavation is occuring. But also down there
lies the entryway to the ancient caverns, where no one dares travel.

rooms.name: A Dark Passage
rooms.description:
This passage extends north into a large cave. The cave emits a glow visible
from here, permeating the perpetual darkness here.

rooms.name: A Fiery Cavern
rooms.description:
This cave is illuminated by a lava pool in the center of the room, in which
a fire drake is currently dozing. He awakes as you enter, and prepares to
cast you out!

rooms.name: A Lab
rooms.description:
This room was once used as a lab, but Baragar grew bored with alchemy,
and abandoned it. Eventually a Grell from the lower caverns made its way
up here, and created a nest in this lab. Baragar was fascinated by the
bizarre creature, and sealed it within, intending one day to study it. He
occasionally feeds it the odd slave or guard.

rooms.name: The Roof of the Inner Keep
rooms.description:
You are standing on the roof, atop the highest point of the whole keep.
The lands of Past Anon lay spread out before you, and from this windswept
position you can see for miles. You hear the cry of some bird, and look
above to see several vultures slowly winging their way toward the desolate
deserts to the south. In those deserts there is rumored to be a fantastic
place filled with wondrous treasures.

rooms.name: The Mines
rooms.description:
Workers rush back and forth, busily carting bags of excavated stone to and
from the digging sites. They are intent on their work, and ignore you. You
see some rather valuable veins of ore in the walls, left untouched, and
you assume the treasure below must be magnificent indeed for Baragar to
ignore such wealth.

rooms.name: The Mines
rooms.description:
Workers rush back and forth, busily carting bags of excavated stone to and
from the digging sites. They are intent on their work, and ignore you. You
see some rather valuable veins of ore in the walls, left untouched, and
you assume the treasure below must be magnificent indeed for Baragar to
ignore such wealth.

rooms.name: The Mines
rooms.description:
Workers rush back and forth, busily carting bags of excavated stone to and
from the digging sites. They are intent on their work, and ignore you. You
see some rather valuable veins of ore in the walls, left untouched, and
you assume the treasure below must be magnificent indeed for Baragar to
ignore such wealth.

rooms.name: The Mines
rooms.description:
Workers rush back and forth, busily carting bags of excavated stone to and
from the digging sites. They are intent on their work, and ignore you. You
see some rather valuable veins of ore in the walls, left untouched, and
you assume the treasure below must be magnificent indeed for Baragar to
ignore such wealth.

rooms.name: The Dog Pits
rooms.description:
Here Baragar keeps his vicious war dogs, which he takes with him when on
campaigns as guards and hunters of fleeing prey. They are incredibly savage
and will attack anyone on sight save Baragar. They will even attack Alara if
she enters unaccompanied.

rooms.name: The Dog Pits
rooms.description:
Here Baragar keeps his vicious war dogs, which he takes with him when on
campaigns as guards and hunters of fleeing prey. They are incredibly savage
and will attack anyone on sight save Baragar. They will even attack Alara if
she enters unaccompanied.
